sn22.83:5.1: “Reverends, the venerable named Puṇṇa Mantāniputta was very helpful to me when I was just ordained.
sn22.83:5.3: ‘Reverend Ānanda, the notion “I am” occurs because of grasping, not without grasping.
sn22.83:5.5: The notion “I am” occurs because of grasping form,
sn22.83:6.1: Suppose there was a woman or man who was young, youthful, and fond of adornments, and they check their own reflection in a clean bright mirror or a clear bowl of water. They’d look because of grasping, not without grasping.
sn22.83:6.2: In the same way, the notion “I am” occurs because of grasping form,
sn22.83:7.1: What do you think, Reverend Ānanda? Is form permanent or impermanent?’
sn22.83:7.10: They understand: “… there is no return to any state of existence.”’
sn22.83:7.11: Reverends, the venerable named Puṇṇa Mantāniputta was very helpful to me when I was just ordained.
sn22.83:7.13: And now that I’ve heard this teaching from Venerable Puṇṇa Mantāniputta, I’ve comprehended the teaching.”
